result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Lee Britt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin Lee Britt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin Lee Britt was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed drug testing. 
Defendant shall participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Lee Britt

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Ct 1 and State moves to dismiss Cts 2, 3, and 4. State will advise court of record and but remain silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1. Cts 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed per agreement. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State states prior record and remains silent as to a sentence recommendation. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 3 years WSPS (18 months in and 18 months out) stayed, with the following conditions 1 set of court costs, counseling, and to submit to random UAs. Court imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: 1 set of court costs, submit to random drug testing, counseling that DOC deems appropriate, and to provide a DNA sample. Court finds defendant eligible for programming.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt.  Per agreement, State moves to dismiss Ct 1 and defendant will be pleading to the rest of the counts. State will advise court of defendant's record but remain silent as to sentencing. Attorney Frank heard on agreement and requests a jury trial. Status date set.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Benjamin Lee Britt. Attorney Frank heard on status of case and requests a plea and sentencing date. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Benjamin Lee Britt. Attorney Pozorksi asks court to take judicial notice of Grant County case 22CF26. Marquette case 21CF178, and Monroe County case 21CF763. Attorney Frank heard on defendant wanting to waive his right to a preliminary hearing and has filed paperwork. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin Lee Britt in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank appears via video. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. Attorney Frank has not been appointed in this case. State requests $250 cash bond. Attorney Frank requests signature bond. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with a condition to contact SPD today. Preliminary hearing set.
